newsitem.title: POLAND: KPW wants Espebepe moved to free market.
newsitem.headline: KPW wants Espebepe moved to free market.

text.p: The Polish Securities Commission (KPW) wants to apply to the Warsaw bourse to move shares of Polish construction company Espebepe SA to the free market from the main market, KPW's chairman said on Friday.
Espebepe, which has about 75 million zloty debts, last week won its largest creditors 80-percent-debt write-off deal.
"The commission decided to apply to the bourse's management not to list on the main market such a company, which has such financial difficulties," Jacek Socha said.
Socha added the KPW would apply to move Espebepe's shares to the free market, for the smalles and least liquid stocks, with higher investment risk.
Last year Espebepe showed a net loss of 56.6 million zlotys.
